clauses.text: Executive power of a State in Scheduled Areas.—Subject to the provisions of this Schedule, the executive power of a State extends to the Scheduled Areas therein.

Report by the Governor to the President regarding the administration of Scheduled Areas.—The Governor of each State having Scheduled Areas therein shall annually, or whenever so required by the President, make a report regarding the administration of the Scheduled Areas in that State and the executive power of the Union shall extend to giving of directions to the State as to the administration of the said areas.

parts.part_title: Administration and Control of Scheduled Areas and Scheduled Tribes

clauses.text: Tribes Advisory Council.—There shall be established in each State having Scheduled Areas a Tribes Advisory Council consisting of not more than twenty members, three-fourths of whom shall be representatives of the Scheduled Tribes in the Legislative Assembly of the State.

sub_clauses.text: It shall be the duty of the Tribes Advisory Council to advise on matters pertaining to the welfare and advancement of Scheduled Tribes as referred by the Governor.
The Governor may make rules prescribing the number of members of the Council, appointment process, conduct of meetings, and other incidental matters.

footnotes: The words 'or Rajpramukh, as the case may be' omitted by the Constitution (Seventh Amendment) Act, 1956, s. 29 and Sch. (w.e.f. 1-11-1956).

clauses.text: Law applicable to Scheduled Areas.—The Governor may direct that any Act of Parliament or State Legislature shall not apply to a Scheduled Area or apply with exceptions and modifications. Governor may also make regulations for peace and good government of a Scheduled Area.

sub_clauses.text: Prohibit or restrict the transfer of land by or among members of the Scheduled Tribes.
Regulate allotment of land to members of Scheduled Tribes.
Regulate business of money-lending to members of Scheduled Tribes.

clauses.text: Scheduled Areas means such areas as the President may by order declare to be Scheduled Areas.

sub_clauses.text: The President may at any time by order direct changes in Scheduled Areas—
Cease any area to be a Scheduled Area or part thereof.
Increase the area of any Scheduled Area after consultation with the Governor of that State.
Alter boundaries of any Scheduled Area by rectification of boundaries.
On alteration of State boundaries or admission of new territory, declare new areas as Scheduled Areas.
Rescind orders relating to Scheduled Areas and redefine them in consultation with State Governor.

footnotes: See the Scheduled Areas (Part A States) Order, 1950, the Scheduled Areas (Part B States) Order, 1950, and amendments.
Ins. by the Fifth Schedule to the Constitution (Amendment) Act, 1976 (101 of 1976), s. 2 (w.e.f. 7-9-1976).

clauses.text: Parliament may by law amend this Schedule by addition, variation or repeal of provisions. Any reference in the Constitution to this Schedule shall be construed as reference to the Schedule as amended.
